string.name: wp_infection_control_dateofbirth_label
string.context: Used to display the patient's date of birth. %1$@ is the patient's date of birth in medium date format, like 'May 16, 2019'

string.name: wp_infection_control_dateofbirth_accessibility_label
string.context: Used to display the patient's date of birth. %1$@ is the patient's date of birth in medium date format, like 'May 16, 2019'

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_unknown
string.context: Status displayed based on available test results, indicating that the patient has not yet been tested.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_unknown_subtext_with_org
string.context: Used to add additional context for the unknown test result status. %1$@ is the local organization the patient is logged in to.

resources.string: %1$@ has no information about your COVID-19 tests.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_pending
string.context: Status displayed based on available test results, indicating that a test has been ordered but not yet resulted/released.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_pending_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the pending test result status. %1$@ is the ordering provider of the test. %2$@ is the organization that ordered the test. %3$@ is the medium formatted date that the test was ordered, like 'May 16, 2019'.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_not_detected
string.context: Status displayed based on available test results, indicating that virus that causes COVID-19 has NOT been detected.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_detected
string.context: Status displayed based on available test results, indicating that virus that causes COVID-19 has been detected.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_daysago
plurals.context: Displayed below the status based on available test results to indicate how long ago a test was resulted. %1$@ is the number of days ago that the test was resulted, like '4

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_tested_but_old
plurals.context: Status displayed based on available test results, indicating that a patient has been tested for COVID-19, but the test is too old to be considered 'recent'. %1$@ is the number of days that detemine recency.
plurals.item: No COVID-19 test results found from the past day
No COVID-19 test results found from the past %1$@ days

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_not_detected_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the 'not detected' test result status. %1$@ is the organization that completed the test. %2$@ is the medium formatted date that the test was resulted, like 'May 16, 2019'.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_detected_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the 'detected' test result status. %1$@ is the organization that completed the test. %2$@ is the medium formatted date that the test was resulted, like 'May 16, 2019'.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_test_not_detected
string.context: Status displayed for a past test result, indicating that virus that causes COVID-19 has NOT been detected.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_test_detected
string.context: Status displayed for a past test result, indicating that virus that causes COVID-19 has been detected.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_tested_but_old_widget_text
string.context: Status displayed on the prelogin widget based on available test results, indicating that a patient has been tested for COVID-19, but the test is too old to be considered 'recent'.

resources.string: No recent COVID-19 test results found

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_header_label
string.context: Header label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, marking it as the most recent test result details

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_name_label
string.context: Label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, for the name of the test.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_status_label
string.context: Label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, for the status of the test.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_collected_label
string.context: Label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, for the date/time the test was collected.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_resulted_label
string.context: Label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, for the date/time the test was resulted.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_performed_label
string.context: Label shown in Covid Testing status subtext, for the name of the location where the test was performed.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_subtext_date_time_with_timezone
string.context: Formatted date shown for a covid test result, indicating the date, time and timezone a test was resulted or collected. %1$@ is the formatted date and time in medium format, like 'Nov 23, 2020 7:46pm'. %2$@ is the timezone marker, like 'CST'.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_test_status_hoursago
plurals.context: Displayed below the status based on available test results to indicate how long ago a test was resulted. %1$@ is the number of hours ago that the test was resulted, like '4

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_subtext_header_label
string.context: Header label shown in Covid Self-assessment status subtext, marking it as the most recent self-assessment

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_subtext_view_details
string.context: Button shown in Covid status subtext views, which takes the user to their full test result or screening details.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_not_screened
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has not answered a screening in the last 24 hrs.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_not_screened_subtext_with_org
string.context: Used to add additional context for the not-screened screening status. %1$@ is the local organization the patient is logged in to.

resources.string: %1$@ has no COVID-19 self-assessments from you in the last 24 hours.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_no_score
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a screening in the last 24 hrs, and no score was returned

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - Failed to determine risk of infection

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_no_score_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the screened-no score screening status.

resources.string: Contact your clinician to discuss your answers and determine your risk of currently having COVID-19.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_nothing_reported
string.context: Status displayed based on available COVID-19 questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a non-scoring screening in the last 24 hrs, and no symptoms or exposure was reported. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - No symptoms or exposure reported

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_nothing_reported_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the non-scored, nothing reported questionnaire screening status. 'Consult' means 'check with', and 'provider' refers to a health care provider (human).

resources.string: Continue to follow public health COVID-19 recommendations, and consult a doctor if you develop severe symptoms, become concerned about exposure to COVID-19, or have any concerns about your health.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_symptoms_reported
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a non-scoring screening in the last 24 hrs, and symptoms were reported. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - One or more symptoms reported

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_symptoms_reported_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the non-scored, symptoms reported screening status. %1$@ is an emergency phone number. 'Consult' means 'check with', and 'provider' refers to a health care provider (human).

resources.string: Continue to monitor your symptoms. If you are concerned about your symptoms, consult your doctor. If your symptoms are severe or become severe, call %1$@.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_exposure_reported
string.context: Status displayed based on available COVID-19 questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a non-scoring screening in the last 24 hrs, and exposure was reported. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_exposure_reported_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the non-scored, exposure reported screening status. %1$@ is an emergency phone number. 'Consult' means 'check with', and 'provider' refers to a health care provider (human).

resources.string: If you are concerned about your COVID-19 exposure, consult your doctor. If you develop severe symptoms, call %1$@.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_symptoms_and_exposure_reported
string.context: Status displayed based on available COVID-19 questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a non-scoring screening in the last 24 hrs, and both symptoms and exposure was reported. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - One or more symptoms and COVID-19 exposure reported

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_symptoms_and_exposure_reported_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the non-scored, both symptoms and exposure reported screening status. %1$@ is an emergency phone number. 'Consult' means 'check with', and 'provider' refers to a health care provider (human).

resources.string: Continue to monitor your symptoms. If you are concerned about your symptoms or COVID-19 exposure, consult your doctor. If symptoms are severe or become severe, call %1$@.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_no_risk_questions
string.context: Status displayed based on available COVID-19 questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a non-scoring screening in the last 24 hrs that didn't have any risk questions. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_non_scored_no_risk_questions_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the non-scored, no risk questions screening status. %1$@ is the name of the header for resource links ('Helpful Resources' in English)

resources.string: Continue to wear a mask and practise social distancing. View the %1$@ section to learn more about COVID-19.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_high_risk
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a screening in the last 24 hrs, and the patient has high risk.

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - High risk of infection

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_low_risk
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a screening in the last 24 hrs, and the patient has low risk.

resources.string: Self-assessment complete - Low risk of infection

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_positive_test
string.context: Status displayed based on available questionnaire screenings, indicating that the patient has answered a screening in the last 24 hrs, and the patient indicated they have had a positive test.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_positive_test_subtext
string.context: Used to add additional context for the 'positive test reported' screening status.

resources.string: Your latest self-assessment reported a positive COVID-19 test result.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_hours_ago
plurals.context: Displayed next to the status based on available questionnaire screenings to indicate how long ago a screening was completed. %1$@ is the number of hours ago that the questionnaire was completed, like '4

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_zero_hours_ago
string.context: Displayed next to the status based on available questionnaire screenings to indicate that a screening was completed less than an hour ago.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_screening_status_screened_action_label
string.context: Button text that links the user to a new screening questionnaire

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_high_risk
string.context: Status displayed for a past questionnaire screening, indicating that the screening determined the patient had high risk.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_low_risk
string.context: Status displayed for a past questionnaire screening, indicating that the screening determined the patient had low risk.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_positive_test
string.context: Status displayed for a past questionnaire screening, indicating that the patient reported they had a positive test in their screening.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_no_score
string.context: Status displayed for a past questionnaire screening, indicating that the screening was not able to determine a risk for the patient.

resources.string: Failed to determine risk of infection

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_non_scored_nothing_reported
string.context: Status displayed for a past non-scored questionnaire screening, indicating that the patient didn't report symptoms or exposure.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_non_scored_symptoms_reported
string.context: Status displayed for a past non-scored questionnaire screening, indicating that the patient reported symptoms.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_non_scored_exposure_reported
string.context: Status displayed for a past non-scored questionnaire screening, indicating that the patient reported exposure.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_non_scored_symptoms_and_exposure_reported
string.context: Status displayed for a past non-scored questionnaire screening, indicating that the patient reported symptoms and exposure.

resources.string: One or more symptoms and COVID-19 exposure reported

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screening_non_scored_no_risk_questions
string.context: Status displayed for a past non-scored questionnaire screening that did not have any risk questions. 'Complete' means the questionnaire screening was answered.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_not_started
string.context: Status displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient has not had any.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_not_started_subtext_with_org
string.context: Subtext displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient has not had any. %1$@ is the local organization the patient is logged in to.

resources.string: %1$@ has no information about your COVID-19 vaccinations.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_unknown
string.context: Status displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient's status is unknown.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_unknown_subtext
string.context: Subtext displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient's status is unknown.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_completed_doses
plurals.context: Status displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating the number of doses the patient has had. %1$@ is the number of doses received.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_completed_doses_prelogin
plurals.context: Text displayed the Prelogin Covid widget based on administered vaccines, indicating the number of doses the patient has had. %1$@ is the number of doses received.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_next_dose_subtitle
string.context: Subtitle displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient has an upcoming dose due. %1$@ is the date the vaccine is due in medium date format, like 'Dec 10, 2020'

resources.string: Next dose due on or after %1$@

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_next_booster_subtitle
string.context: Subtitle displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating that the patient has an upcoming booster dose recommended. %1$@ is the date after which the booster is recommended in medium date format, like 'Dec 10, 2020'

resources.string: Booster dose recommended on or after %1$@

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_last_dose_subtitle
string.context: Subtitle displayed based on administered vaccines, indicating when the patient had their most recent dose. %1$@ is the date that they had their last dose, in medium date format, like 'Dec 10, 2020'

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_incomplete_banner_text
string.context: Warning banner text shown when a patient may have received one or more invalid vaccines on file, to explain why we're not showing any doses received. Provider in this context is a person.

resources.string: Your COVID-19 vaccination information might be incomplete. Check back later, or contact your clinician for more information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_dose_date
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains dose number and date information. %1$@ is the number of the dose (dose 1 is their first shot, etc). %2$@ is the medium formatted date that the vaccine was received, like 'Dec 16, 2019'

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_dose_date_without_dose_number
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains date information. %1$@ is the medium formatted date that the vaccine was received, like 'Dec 16, 2019'

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_name_label
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains the label for name and dose information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_manufacturer_label
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains the label for vaccine manufacturer.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_lot_label
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains the label for the vaccine lot number.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_location_label
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains the label for the location the vaccine was administered.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_vaccine_status_dose_subtext_givenby_label
string.context: Part of subtext shown for an administered vaccine dose, which contains the label for the provider that administered the vaccine.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_results_header
string.context: Header shown before the list of historical test results.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_results_notice
string.context: Message shown after the list of historical results, indicating that not all results are included.

resources.string: Not all COVID-19 test results are shown

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_results_view_all
string.context: Link shown after the list of historical results, which takes the user to the test result list.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screenings_header
string.context: Header shown before the list of historical questionnaire screenings.

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screenings_full_notice
string.context: Message shown after the list of historical questionnaire screenings, indicating that only a certain number of recent screenings are included.

resources.string: Only your five most recent COVID-19 self-assessments are shown. Self-assessments are from the past two weeks

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_hx_screenings_notice_only_recent
string.context: Message shown after the list of historical questionnaire screenings, indicating that only recent screenings are included

resources.string: Self-assessments are from the past two weeks

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_links_header
string.context: Used as a header for a list of links related to COVID-19

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_link_failed
string.context: Message shown when a link fails to launch

string.name: wp_infection_control_covid_link_external_ax_notice
string.context: Accessibility only text that lets the user know that a link opens outside of the app.

string.name: wp_infection_control_information_from
string.context: Title for happy together pop up about where your covid status information is coming from.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_status_h2g_error
plurals.context: Error message shown at the bottom of the screen when the Covid Status activity was unable to load data from a happy together organization. %1$@ is the org name that failed.
plurals.item: We\'re having issues getting data from your linked account, %1$@.
We\'re having issues getting data from your linked accounts.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_covid_status_h2g_error_title
plurals.context: Text shown before a list of external organizations that the Covid Status activity was unable to load data from.

string.name: wp_infection_control_download_record_button_text
string.context: Text for the button to download a PDF record of the vaccination information

string.name: wp_infection_control_download_record_in_progress
string.context: Text for the button indicating to the user that the vaccination record download is in progress

string.name: wp_infection_control_download_taking_long
string.context: Message shown to the user that the vaccination record download is taking long, and they should try later.

resources.string: Generating your PDF is taking longer than expected. Please try again later.

string.name: wp_infection_control_download_failed
string.context: Message shown to the user that the vaccination record download failed, and they should try later.

resources.string: Downloading your PDF failed. Please try again later.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_primary_text
string.context: Primary text for Prelogin Covid Status widget. %1$@ is the name of the patient whose information is shown.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_expand_button
string.context: Text for the button that expands the Prelogin Covid Status details

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_hide_button
string.context: Text for the button that hides the Prelogin Covid Status details

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_lost_access
string.context: Error shown to a patient when they tried to load prelogin covid status, but no longer have access to the feature.

resources.string: You no longer have access to COVID-19 Status Preview.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_general_loading_error
string.context: Error shown to a patient when they tried to load prelogin covid status and there is an error loading

resources.string: Unable to load your COVID-19 Status Preview. Please try again later.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_loading_text
string.context: Text shown while the Prelogin Covid Status details are loading

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_covid_enabled
string.context: Toast shown when a patient successfully enables viewing their COVID-19 Status prelogin.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_overwrite_alert_title
string.context: Title of the alert shown when a patient attempts to enable viewing their COVID-19 Status prelogin, and another user on the device has enabled the feature.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_overwrite_alert_message
string.context: Message of the alert shown when a patient attempts to enable viewing their COVID-19 Status prelogin, and another user on the device has enabled the feature.

resources.string: Enabling COVID-19 Status Preview here will replace any existing preview on this device. Would you like to continue?

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_overwrite_alert_replace_button
string.context: Positive button text on the alert shown when a patient attempts to enable viewing their COVID-19 Status prelogin, and another user on the device has enabled the feature.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_toggle_error
string.context: Toast shown when a patient attempts to enables viewing their COVID-19 Status prelogin, and it fails.

resources.string: There was an issue enabling COVID-19 Status Preview

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_toggle_off_alert_title
string.context: Title of the alert shown when a patient toggles the COVID-19 Status prelogin feature off.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_toggle_off_alert_message
string.context: Message of tthe alert shown when a patient toggles the COVID-19 Status prelogin feature off.

resources.string: Are you sure you want to disable COVID-19 Status Preview?

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_inuse_message_and_secondarylogin
string.context: The message in dialog showed when a user is enabling prelogin covid and a secondary login method and/or prelogin covid has already been set for another user. %1$@ is the name of the biometric method for secondary login, like Touch ID. %2$@ is the name of the organization

resources.string: A passcode, %1$@, or COVID-19 Status Preview has already been set on this device for another user at %2$@. Enabling COVID-19 Status Preview will remove these for the other user. Would you like to continue?

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogincovid_inuse_message_and_passcode
string.context: The message in dialog showed when a user is enabling prelogin covid and a passcode and/or prelogin covid has already been set for another user. %1$@ is the name of the organization

resources.string: A passcode or COVID-19 Status Preview has already been set on this device for another user at %1$@. Enabling COVID-19 Status Preview will remove these for the other user. Would you like to continue?

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_nudge_primary_text
string.context: Text shown in a banner that lets users know they can enable COVID-19 Status Preview.

resources.string: Want to get to your COVID-19 test results and vaccination history faster? Learn how you can see this information before you log in.

string.name: wp_infection_control_learn_more_button
string.context: Positive button shown in a banner that allows patients to launch a workflow with more information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_dismiss_button
string.context: Negative button sbown in a banner that allows patients to dismiss the banner.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_dismissed_toast
string.context: Toast shown when a patient is prompted for COVID-19 Status Preview, and decideds against enabling the feature. %1$@ is the name of the COVID-19 activity.

resources.string: You can turn on COVID-19 Status Preview in Account Settings or in %1$@

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_title
string.context: Title for the initial onboarding page introducing the user to the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_description
string.context: Description for the initial onboarding page introducing the user to the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

resources.string: With this feature enabled, you can quickly access your COVID-19 testing and vaccination status from the login screen. This allows you to easily share your information without logging in.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_description_no_test_results
string.context: Description for the initial onboarding page introducing the user to the COVID-19 Status Preview feature when test results are disabled

resources.string: With this feature enabled, you can quickly access your COVID-19 vaccination status from the login screen. This allows you to easily share your information without logging in.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_overview_title
string.context: Title of the COVID-19 Status Preview feature on the onboarding page prior to a more detailed description

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_overview_intro_text
string.context: Introductory text about the information that will be shown in the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

resources.string: The following information will be shown before you log in to your account.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_overview_tests_item
string.context: Text shown on a row in the onboarding page that states COVID-19 testing status is shown for COVID-19 Status Preview

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_overview_vaccs_item
string.context: Text shown on a row in the onboarding page that states COVID-19 vaccination status is shown for COVID-19 Status Preview

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_overview_demo_item
string.context: Text shown on a row in the onboarding page that states name and DOB is shown for COVID-19 Status Preview

resources.string: Legal name and date of birth

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_lost_device_text
string.context: A detailed description on the onboarding page of the workflow to unlink your device and disable the COVID-19 Status Preview feature. %1$@ is the name of the 'Account Settings' activity in mobile. %2$@ is the name of the 'COVID-19' activity in mobile. %3$@ is the name of the 'Share my Record' activity on the website.

resources.string: You can turn this off later in %1$@ and %2$@ on the app or %3$@ on the website.

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_lost_device_mobile_unlink
string.context: The location on the mobile app where a user may unlink their device and disable the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_enable_button
string.context: Text on a button in the onboarding page to enable the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

string.name: wp_infection_control_prelogin_onboarding_confirmation_decline_button
string.context: Text on a button in the onboarding page to continue without enabling the COVID-19 Status Preview feature

string.name: wp_infection_control_status_share_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to show a menu with options to download/export (share) their covid-19 status

string.name: wp_infection_control_status_share_title
string.context: Title on a menu to show options for the user to share their covid-19 status

resources.string: How would you like to share?

string.name: wp_infection_control_status_share_cancel
string.context: Cancellation button text on a menu to show options for the user to share their covid-19 status

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to allow a user to scan QR Codes containing their covid-19 status

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_intro_text_with_personal_data_disclaimer
plurals.context: Introduction text in the workflow to allow a user to scan QR Codes containing their covid-19 status, and informs the user that their legal name and date of birth are included in the QR Codes.
plurals.item: Scan this QR Code at participating locations to share your COVID-19 information. This QR Code also includes your legal name and date of birth.
Scan these QR Codes at participating locations to share your COVID-19 information. These QR Codes also include your legal name and date of birth.

plurals.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_vaccination_skew_status
plurals.context: Status title used for vaccinations in the scenario that not all vaccinations are eligible to be in a QR Code. Specifies the number (%1$@) of vaccinations included in the QR code
plurals.item: %1$@ vaccine dose included in QR Codes
%1$@ vaccine doses included in QR Codes

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_vaccination_set_number
string.context: Subtext under a vaccination QR Code that details the set number of the current QR Code (%1$@) and also the total number of QR Codes in this section (%2$@)

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_test_result_set_number
string.context: Subtext under a test result QR Code that details the set number of the current QR Code (%1$@) and also the total number of QR Codes in this section (%2$@)

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_vaccination_barcode_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by screen-readers for a vaccination QR Code

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_test_result_barcode_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by screen-readers for a test result QR Code

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_mychart_epic_logo_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by screen-readers for a mychart is epic logo

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_display_prelogin_hide
string.context: Text for the button that hides the Prelogin Covid QR Codes

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_qr_unavailable_banner_text
string.context: Informational banner description text for the case where they may find that vaccinations are not available as a QR Code. %1$@ is the name of the organization providing the data

resources.string: %1$@ does not support displaying your vaccination information as QR Codes.

string.name: wp_infection_control_test_result_qr_unavailable_banner_text
string.context: Informational banner description text for the case where they may find that test results are not available as a QR Code. %1$@ is the name of the organization providing the data

resources.string: %1$@ does not support displaying your test result information as QR Codes.

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_error_title
string.context: Title of the error message shown when QR Code generation failed, for COVID vaccinations, COVID test results, or both.

string.name: wp_infection_control_qr_error_body
string.context: Body of the error message shown when QR Code generation failed, for COVID vaccinations, COVID test results, or both.

resources.string: Please try again later or contact your healthcare organisation if the problem persists.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_another_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to allow a user to export their covid-19 status to another health wallet application

resources.string: Export to another digital wallet app

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to allow a user to export their covid-19 status to a health wallet application

resources.string: Export to a digital wallet app

string.name: wp_infection_control_apple_wallet_and_health_export_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to allow a user to export their covid-19 status to Apple Wallet or Apple Health

resources.string: Add to Apple Wallet or Health

string.name: wp_infection_control_apple_health_export_button
string.context: Text on a button in the covid-19 status page to allow a user to export their covid-19 status to Apple Health

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_title
string.context: Introduction text in onboarding to introduce them to the export to health wallet workflow

resources.string: Export to a digital wallet app

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_description
string.context: Description text in onboarding to introduce them to the export to health wallet workflow

resources.string: Export your most recent COVID-19 vaccination and test result information to digital wallet apps on your device that support SMART Health Cards.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_required_title
string.context: Title text in onboarding to educate on the prerequisites to using the export to health wallet workflow

resources.string: Ensure that a digital wallet app is installed

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_required_description
string.context: Subtext in onboarding to educate on the prerequisites to using the export to health wallet workflow

resources.string: The export will not be successful if there is not a compatible digital wallet app installed.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_definition_title
string.context: Title text in onboarding to educate on the definition of a health wallet for the export to health wallet workflow

resources.string: What is a digital wallet app?

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_definition_text
string.context: Description text in onboarding to educate on the definition of a health wallet for the export to health wallet workflow.

resources.string: Digital wallet apps can store a variety of items including credit cards, event tickets, and healthcare data. If your digital wallet app supports SMART Health Cards, you can save your COVID-19 information and share it when needed, even if you\'re offline.

string.name: wp_infection_control_smart_health_card_definition_title
string.context: Title text in onboarding to educate on the definition of a SMART health card for the export to health wallet workflow.

resources.string: What is a SMART Health Card?

string.name: wp_infection_control_smart_health_card_definition_text
string.context: Description text in onboarding to educate on the definition of a SMART health card for the export to health wallet workflow.

resources.string: SMART Health Cards are digital versions of your healthcare information that you can easily share.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_title
string.context: Title text in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_description_choice
string.context: Subtext in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. Options of what to include for the export will be shown below.

resources.string: Select what information you would like to export

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_description_no_choice
string.context: Subtext in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. There is only one option available so the user will only be exporting that option

resources.string: The following information will be exported

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_vaccination_card_title
string.context: Vaccination export option title text in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. This will be selectable as an option to export to a health wallet

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_vaccination_card_subtext
string.context: Vaccination export option subtext in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. This will be selectable as an option to export to a health wallet

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_test_result_card_title
string.context: Test Result export option title in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. This will be selectable as an option to export to a health wallet

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_test_result_card_subtext
string.context: Test Result export option subtext in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. This will be selectable as an option to export to a health wallet

resources.string: Your most recent COVID-19 test result

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_personal_data_disclaimer
string.context: Disclaimer text in the main page of the export to health wallet workflow. This informs the user that their legal name and date of birth are included in the export.

resources.string: This export also includes your legal name and date of birth.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_selected_card_accessibility
string.context: Accessibility text read out when the user hovers over an export option that is currently selected in the export to health wallet workflow. The selected pre-text is handled by the screenreader. %1$@ is the export option title, %2$@ is the subtext

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_unselected_card_accessibility
string.context: Accessibility text read out when the user hovers over an export option that is currently not selected in the export to health wallet workflow. %1$@ is the export option title, %2$@ is the subtext

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_export_button
string.context: Text for the export button that initiates the export to health wallet workflow

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_close_button
string.context: Text for the close button that exits the export to health wallet workflow

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_selection_no_options_selected
string.context: Text for the alert toast shown that informs the user to select at least one option to export a health wallet

resources.string: Please select at least one option to export

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_chooser_title
string.context: Text for the chooser shown when the user is deciding which health wallet to export to after initiating the export

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_export_failed
string.context: Error text for the alert toast shown when the export to a health wallet has failed

resources.string: Failed to export. Please try again later.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_vaccination_export_unavailable_banner_text
string.context: Informational banner description text for the case where they may find that vaccinations are not available for export to health card. %1$@ is the name of the organization providing the data

resources.string: %1$@ does not support exporting your vaccination information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_wallet_test_result_export_unavailable_banner_text
string.context: Informational banner description text for the case where they may find that the test results are not available for export to health card. %1$@ is the name of the organization providing the data

resources.string: %1$@ does not support exporting your test result information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_unreconciled_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text indicating that this dose of the patients vaccination status has not been reviewed by a provider for sharing

resources.string: This vaccination information has not been reviewed by a provider

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_partial_unreconciled_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text for the case that one or more doses of the patients vaccination status has not been reviewed by a provider for sharing

resources.string: Some vaccination information has not been reviewed by a provider

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_all_unreconciled_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text for the case that all doses of the patients vaccination status has not been reviewed by a provider for sharing

resources.string: Your vaccination information has not been reviewed by a provider

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_unsupported_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text indicating that this dose of the patients vaccination status cannot be shared

resources.string: This vaccination information cannot be shared

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_partial_unsupported_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text for the case that one or more doses of the patients vaccination status cannot be shared

resources.string: Some vaccination information cannot be shared

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_all_unsupported_banner_title
string.context: Warning banner title text for the case that all doses of the patients vaccination status cannot be shared

resources.string: Your vaccination information cannot be shared

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_banner_description_main
string.context: Warning banner description text for the case that some portions of the users COVID-19 status is not available for QR Codes or export. 'It' is referring to the term 'vaccination information'.

resources.string: It will not be included in anything you download, export, or share as proof of vaccination.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_banner_description_barcodes_not_included
string.context: Warning banner description text for the case that some portions of the users COVID-19 status are not available for QR Codes. 'It' is referring to the term 'vaccination information'.

resources.string: It is not included in QR Codes.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_banner_description_barcodes_not_available
string.context: Warning banner description text for the case that all portions of the users COVID-19 status are not available for QR Codes. 'It' is referring to the term 'vaccination information'.

resources.string: It is not available as a QR code.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccination_banner_description_export
string.context: Warning banner description text for the case that some portions of the users COVID-19 status is not available for export. 'It' is referring to the term 'vaccination information'

resources.string: It is not included in the export.

string.name: wp_infection_control_external_onboarding_link_accessibility_note
string.context: Snippet read out after an external health wallet onboarding link to notify voice assistant users that this will take them out of the app. %1$@ is the preceding text of the onboarding link

string.name: wp_infection_control_warning_banner_icon_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text read out for the icon of a warning banner.

string.name: wp_infection_control_success_banner_icon_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text read out for the icon of a success banner.

string.name: wp_infection_control_alert_banner_icon_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text read out for the icon of an alert banner.

string.name: wp_infection_control_information_banner_icon_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text read out for the icon of an informational banner.

string.name: wp_infection_control_default_query_title
string.context: Title for the query banner that the patient can use to query state government registries to get updated vaccination information

string.name: wp_infection_control_default_query_message
string.context: Message for the query banner that the patient can use to query state government registries to get updated vaccination information

resources.string: If you received a COVID-19 vaccine and don\'t see it here, check for updates from vaccination registries.

string.name: wp_infection_control_default_sync_message
string.context: Message for the sync banner that the patient can use to sync external vaccines to get updated vaccination information

resources.string: If you received a COVID-19 vaccine and don\'t see it here, check for updates from your linked accounts.

string.name: wp_infection_control_default_query_and_sync_message
string.context: Message for the query and sync banner that the patient can use to query state government registries and sync external vaccines to get updated vacciation information

resources.string: If you received a COVID-19 vaccine and don\'t see it here, check for updates from vaccination registries and your linked accounts.

string.name: wp_infection_control_query_primary_button_text
string.context: Button text for the button that the patient can use to query state government registries to get updated vaccination information

string.name: wp_infection_control_query_secondary_button_text
string.context: Button text for the button that the patient can use dismiss the query banner

string.name: wp_infection_control_loading_query_title
string.context: Title for the query banner while we are loading vaccination information from state government registries

string.name: wp_infection_control_loading_query_message
string.context: Message for the query banner that tells patients that they might have to wait a few seconds while we load vaccination information from state government registries

resources.string: This may take a few seconds.

string.name: wp_infection_control_success_query_title
string.context: Title for the query banner indicating that we successfully updated the patient's vaccination information from the state government registries

string.name: wp_infection_control_success_query_message
string.context: Message for the query banner indicating that we successfully updated the patient's vaccination information from the state government registries

resources.string: Your vaccination information has been updated.

string.name: wp_infection_control_failed_query_title
string.context: Title for the query banner indicating that the web service checking the state government registries timed out without receiving any new vaccination information

resources.string: We didn\'t get an update from vaccination registries yet.

string.name: wp_infection_control_failed_sync_title
string.context: Title for the sync banner indicating that the web service checking the patient's linked accounts timed out without receiving any new vaccination information

resources.string: We didn\'t get any updates yet.

string.name: wp_infection_control_no_data_query_title
string.context: Title for the query banner indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the state government registries

resources.string: We didn\'t get any new information from vaccination registries.

string.name: wp_infection_control_no_data_sync_title
string.context: Title for the query banner indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the patient's linked accounts

resources.string: We didn\'t get any new information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_failed_query_message
string.context: Message for the query banner indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the state government registries

resources.string: Check back later, or contact your healthcare provider for additional help.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_send_careteam_message_title
string.context: Title for the banner that allows a patient to send a message to their care team to either accept or deny an unreconciled vaccination

resources.string: Does this dose match your vaccination card?

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_vaccination
string.context: Button title for the button to confirm that a patient received the vaccination

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_deny_vaccination
string.context: Button title for the button to deny that a patient has received the vaccination

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_deny_vaccination_no_questionnaire
string.context: Button title for the button to deny that a patient has received the vaccination but there is no vaccine questionnaire available

string.name: wp_infection_control_enter_vaccine_details_button_text
string.context: Button text for the button that the patient can use to manually enter vaccination information

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_request_submitted_title
string.context: Title for the query banner indicating that the patient successfully submitted a request to update their vaccination

resources.string: Your vaccination information has been submitted

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_request_submitted_message
string.context: Message for the query banner indicating that the patient successfully submitted a request to update their vaccination

resources.string: Your information will be updated after it has been reviewed.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_vaccination_verified_title
string.context: Title for the banner indicating that the patient's vaccination was verified and will be added to their chart

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_vaccination_verified_message
string.context: Message for the banner indicating that the patient's vaccination was verified and will be added to their chart

resources.string: This vaccination has been added to your record.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_vaccination_deleted_title
string.context: Title for the banner indicating that the patient's vaccination was deleted and will be removed from their chart

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_vaccination_error_title
string.context: Title for the banner indicating that there was an error in the web service to update the patient's vaccination

resources.string: We were unable to process your request for this dose

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_vaccination_error_message
string.context: Message for the banner indicating that there was an error in the web service to update the patient's vaccination

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_enter_details
string.context: Message for the banner indicating that the patient can manually enter vaccine details

resources.string: You can enter your vaccination information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_enter_details_add_dose
string.context: Message for the banner that shows after discarding a vaccine indicating that the patient can enter vaccine details to add a new dose

resources.string: To add a new dose, enter your vaccination information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_add_popup_title
string.context: Title for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to add the vaccination dose.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_add_popup_message
string.context: Message for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to add the vaccination dose. %1$@ is the date the vaccination dose was administered

resources.string: Are you sure you want to add the dose administered on %1$@ to your record?

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_add_popup_button
string.context: Text for the popup button that confirms that the user wants to add the vaccination dose.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_title
string.context: Title for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to discard the vaccination dose.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_title_no_questionnaire
string.context: Title for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to discard the vaccination dose but there is no vaccine questionnaire available.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_message
string.context: Message for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to discard the vaccination dose. %1$@ is the date the vaccination dose was administered

resources.string: If you continue, the dose administered on %1$@ will not be added to your record. You may enter correct dose information after continuing.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_message_no_questionnaire
string.context: Message for the popup asking the user to confirm if they want to discard the vaccination dose but there is no vaccine questionnaire available. %1$@ is the date the vaccination dose was administered

resources.string: Are you sure you want to dismiss the dose administered on %1$@? It will not be added to your record.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_button
string.context: Text for the popup button that confirms that the user wants to discard the vaccination dose.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_remove_popup_button_no_questionnaire
string.context: Text for the popup button that confirms that the user wants to discard the vaccination dose but there is no vaccine questionnaire available.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_confirm_back_popup_button
string.context: Text for the popup button that cancels the update of the vaccination dose and takes the user back out of the popup

string.name: wp_infection_control_failed_query_try_again_or_enter_details
string.context: Part of the message for the query banner indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the vaccination registries and the patient can manually enter vaccine details

resources.string: Check back later. If the registries still don\'t return your vaccination information, you can enter your vaccination details.

string.name: wp_infection_control_failed_sync_try_again_or_enter_details
string.context: Part of the message for the query banner indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the patient's linked accounts and the patient can manually enter vaccine details

resources.string: Check back later. If you still don\'t see your vaccination information, you can enter it yourself.

string.name: wp_infection_control_recon_requires_review_warning
string.context: Message for the banner that allows a patient to request reconciliation of a vaccine that warns them they will not be able to share it as proof of vaccination until it is verified by a provider

resources.string: Until a provider confirms you\'ve received this dose, it will not be included in anything you download, export, or share as proof of vaccination.

string.name: wp_infection_control_quick_access_options_header
string.context: Header text for an options menu that can toggle features related to accessing COVID-19 vaccination credentials quicker

string.name: wp_infection_control_enable_status_preview_toggle_label
string.context: Label text for a switch that toggles the pre-login COVID-19 status widget

resources.string: View COVID-19 information on the pre-login screen

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_sync_learn_more_title
string.context: Title for the screen giving patients more info about syncing updated vaccination information to their chart at the local organization. %1$@ is the app display name (i.e. MyChart)

string.name: wp_infection_control_update_sources_text
string.context: Text describing a list of various sources that were checked for updated vaccination information, and then synced to the patient's chart at the local organization. %1$@ is the app display name (i.e. MyChart)

resources.string: %1$@ checked for updated vaccination information from the following sources:

string.name: wp_infection_control_update_sources_query_registry
string.context: Text listing the vaccination registries as a source that were checked for updated vaccination information. %1$@ is the branded name of the local organization

string.name: wp_infection_control_update_sources_warning_unreconciled_vaccines
string.context: Warning text for a list item, telling the patient that a specific organization has unreconciled vaccines and was not checked for updated vaccination information

string.name: wp_infection_control_learn_more_warning_unreconciled_vaccines
string.context: Warning to the patient on the vaccine sync learn more screen that at least one of their linked accounts has unreconciled vaccines

resources.string: Some of your linked accounts have unreviewed vaccination information, which was not included in the most recent update. This information might become available after it is reviewed by you or your clinicians at those organisations.

string.name: wp_infection_control_learn_more_warning_unsupported_orgs
string.context: Warning to the patient on the vaccine sync learn more screen that at least one of their linked accounts doesn't support syncing vaccines

resources.string: Your other linked accounts do not support this feature yet, and they were not checked in the most recent update.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_sync_try_again_or_enter_details
string.context: Text on the vaccine sync learn more screen indicating that the web service checking the patient's linked accounts timed out without receiving any new vaccination information, and the patient can manually enter vaccine details

resources.string: If you still don\'t see your vaccination information, you can try again later or enter it yourself.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_sync_try_again_or_contact_provider
string.context: Text on the vaccine sync learn more screen indicating that the web service checking the patient's linked accounts timed out without receiving any new vaccination information

resources.string: If you still don\'t see your vaccination information, you can try again later or contact your healthcare provider for additional help.

string.name: wp_infection_control_no_data_sync_enter_details
string.context: Text on the vaccine sync learn more screen indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the patient's linked accounts and the patient can manually enter vaccine details

resources.string: If your vaccination information listed here is incomplete, you can enter updates yourself.

string.name: wp_infection_control_no_data_sync_contact_provider
string.context: Text on the vaccine sync learn more screen indicating that we did not receive any new vaccination information from the patient's linked accounts

resources.string: Contact your healthcare provider for additional help.

string.name: wp_infection_control_vaccine_sync_updated_information_text
string.context: Text on the vaccine sync learn more screen telling the patient that their providers will be able to access their new vaccination information. %1$@ is the branded name of the local organization

resources.string: Your providers at %1$@ have access to your updated vaccination information.

string.name: wp_infection_control_os_wallet_add_to_apple_wallet_and_health_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by VoiceOver for the Add to Apple Wallet and Health button that exports information to Apple Wallet and Health. %1$@ is the type of information that will be exported, like vaccination or test result information

resources.string: Add %1$@ to Apple Wallet and Health. Opens externally

string.name: wp_infection_control_os_wallet_works_with_apple_health_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by VoiceOver for the Works with Apple Health button that exports information to Apple Health. %1$@ is the type of information that will be exported, like vaccination or test result information

resources.string: Add %1$@ to Apple Health. Opens externally

string.name: wp_infection_control_os_wallet_add_to_apple_wallet_accessibility_label
string.context: Accessibility text read out by VoiceOver for the Add to Apple Wallet button that exports Covid-19 vaccination information to Apple Wallet.
